title.narrative: F.a: Defending Trade Union Rights of Vulnerable Groups

description.narrative: In the extra-component of the project the cooperation and mutual learning between Colombia?s trade union education and research institute ENS and Ecuador?s trade union education and research institute ENSec is strengthened. Colombia?s ENS has a long experi ence on education and research activities whereas Ecuador?s ENSec was established only in spring 2015 and is in the beginning of its journey. Colombia?s ENS strategically supported for the establishment of ENSec.With the budget increase a year-long mentori ng and exchange programme between Colombian and Ecuadorian researchers and/or trainings is implemented. In the programme the idea is to deepen the training of trainers, strategic planning and systematic research capacity. Ecuador?s ENSec benefits from Colo mbians? experience and knowledge while Colombia?s ENS benefits from strengthening their regional networks and systematisation of their own strengths.SASK has supported Ecuador?s ENSec establishment and its activities in 2015-2016 together with Finnish Elec trical Workers? Union (project no. 3020). ENSec?s operations and activities started very well but making the organisation self-contained remains a challenge. The cooperation project with ENSec was cut during the agreement period when SASK focused its work in Latin America only to Colombia. The idea in the budget increase is to strengthen the capacities and know-how as well as deepen the cooperation through south-south cooperation between the two countries.For administrative reasons the extra-component will be attached to SASK?s and ENS?s cooperation project no. 3019 (Defending trade union rights of vulnerable groups) which contains three different components related to domestic workers?, farm workers? and young workers? rights promotion.
